metadata.title: CVE-2021-3778 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
vim is vulnerable to Heap-based Buffer Overflow

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3778` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
vim-athena - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
vim-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
vim-gtk - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
vim-gui-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
vim-nox - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
vim-runtime - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
vim-tiny - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
xxd - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.3').
